capabilities.name: Agent Mode
capabilities.description: Agentic coding tool that autonomously reads codebase, edits files, runs commands, and self-corrects. Plans approach, implements across multiple files, verifies results.

sources.description: Claude Code overview - agentic coding tool capabilities
sources.excerpt: Claude Code is an agentic coding tool that reads your codebase, edits files, runs commands, and integrates with your development tools.

sources.description: Claude Code changelog - agent mode updates and improvements
sources.excerpt: Claude Code changelog tracking agentic coding tool updates, improvements, and new capability releases across all supported platforms.

capabilities.name: Sub-agents
capabilities.description: Spawn multiple Claude Code agents to work on different parts of a task simultaneously. A lead agent coordinates work, assigns subtasks, and merges results.

sources.description: Claude Code Sub-agents documentation - spawning parallel agents for coordinated work

capabilities.name: Code Generation
capabilities.description: Generate code in multiple programming languages from natural language descriptions, including full feature implementations across multiple files

sources.description: Claude Code overview - code generation from natural language
sources.excerpt: Describe what you want in plain language. Claude Code plans the approach, writes the code across multiple files, and verifies it works.

capabilities.name: Code Explanation
capabilities.description: Analyze and explain existing code, trace through complex logic, understand entire codebases

sources.description: Claude Code overview - code analysis and explanation capabilities
sources.excerpt: Claude Code is an AI-powered coding assistant that helps you build features, fix bugs, and automate development tasks. It understands your entire codebase.

capabilities.name: Debugging
capabilities.description: Trace bugs through codebase, identify root causes, and implement fixes. Can run tests and verify fixes work.

sources.description: Claude Code overview - debugging with test execution and fix verification
sources.excerpt: For bugs, paste an error message or describe the symptom. Claude Code traces the issue through your codebase, identifies the root cause, and implements a fix.

capabilities.name: Code Refactoring
capabilities.description: Refactor code across multiple files with coordinated changes

sources.description: Claude Code overview - multi-file refactoring capabilities
sources.excerpt: Claude Code is an agentic coding tool that reads your codebase, edits files, runs commands, and integrates with your development tools.

capabilities.name: Documentation Generation
capabilities.description: Generate code documentation, README files, and API documentation

sources.description: Claude Code overview - documentation generation capabilities
sources.excerpt: Claude Code handles the tedious tasks that eat up your day: writing tests for untested code, fixing lint errors across a project, resolving merge conflicts, updating dependencies, and writing release notes.

capabilities.name: Chat Assistance
capabilities.description: Interactive conversational coding assistance with full codebase context

sources.description: Claude Code overview - interactive conversational coding assistance
sources.excerpt: Claude Code is an AI-powered coding assistant that helps you build features, fix bugs, and automate development tasks. It understands your entire codebase and can work across multiple files and tools.

capabilities.name: Multi-file Editing
capabilities.description: Direct file creation, editing, and deletion across entire projects with coordinated changes

sources.description: Claude Code overview - direct file creation and editing across projects
sources.excerpt: Describe what you want in plain language. Claude Code plans the approach, writes the code across multiple files, and verifies it works.

capabilities.name: Terminal CLI
capabilities.description: Full-featured CLI for working directly in your terminal. Runs shell commands, manages git, executes build pipelines.

sources.description: Claude Code CLI reference - full command and flag documentation

capabilities.name: MCP Support
capabilities.description: Model Context Protocol integration for connecting to external tools - Jira, Slack, Google Drive, databases, and custom tooling

sources.description: Claude Code MCP documentation - Model Context Protocol integration for external tools
Claude Code MCP setup tutorial - step-by-step MCP server configuration

capabilities.name: Custom Instructions
capabilities.description: CLAUDE.md context files for project-specific coding standards, architecture decisions, preferred libraries, and review checklists. Custom slash commands (skills) for reusable workflows. Cascading configuration: system, user (~/.claude/), project (.claude/), and local (.claude.local/) levels auto-loaded.

sources.description: CLAUDE.md documentation - project-specific context files for coding standards and architecture
Claude Code Skills documentation - custom slash commands for reusable workflows

capabilities.name: Multi-language Support
capabilities.description: Support for all major programming languages

sources.description: Claude Code overview - multi-language programming support
sources.excerpt: Claude Code is an agentic coding tool that reads your codebase, edits files, runs commands, and integrates with your development tools. Available in your terminal, IDE, desktop app, and browser.

capabilities.name: Token Caching
capabilities.description: Anthropic prompt caching reduces API costs and latency by reusing cached prefixes across repeated requests. Claude Code automatically benefits when large CLAUDE.md or codebase context is included in repeated calls.

sources.description: Anthropic prompt caching documentation - reduce costs and latency with cached prefixes

capabilities.name: Extended Thinking
capabilities.description: Extended thinking mode for complex reasoning tasks, architecture decisions, and multi-step problem solving

sources.description: Claude Code overview - extended thinking mode for complex reasoning
sources.excerpt: Claude Code is an AI-powered coding assistant that helps you build features, fix bugs, and automate development tasks. It understands your entire codebase and can work across multiple files and tools.

sources.description: Anthropic model documentation - extended thinking capabilities
sources.excerpt: Anthropic model documentation covering extended thinking capabilities, reasoning performance, and model-specific features for complex tasks.

capabilities.name: Vision
capabilities.description: Analyze images including code screenshots, diagrams, wireframes, and error messages

sources.description: Claude Code overview - image analysis capabilities
sources.excerpt: Claude Code is an AI-powered coding assistant that helps you build features, fix bugs, and automate development tasks. It understands your entire codebase and can work across multiple files and tools.

sources.description: Anthropic model documentation - vision capabilities
sources.excerpt: Anthropic model documentation covering vision and multimodal capabilities including image analysis and understanding across Claude models.

capabilities.name: Prompt and Context Inspector
capabilities.description: /context visualizes current context usage as a colored grid. /compact manages context size with optional focus instructions. Status line (configurable via /statusline) displays context window usage continuously. CLAUDE.md content visible as project context.

sources.description: Claude Code CLI reference - /context, /compact, /statusline commands

capabilities.name: Debug Logging
capabilities.description: --debug flag with category filtering (e.g. 'api,hooks', 'api,mcp', '!statsig'). --verbose for full turn-by-turn output (Ctrl+O toggle in session). /debug reads session debug log. /doctor checks installation health: MCP server errors, settings validation, keybinding issues, context warnings. MCP servers debuggable via 'claude mcp list/get' and /mcp. OpenTelemetry (OTLP) metric export via OTEL_METRICS_EXPORTER.

sources.description: Claude Code CLI reference - --debug flag, /debug, /doctor commands
Claude Code Settings documentation - debug configuration and OTEL metrics export

capabilities.name: Usage Tracking
capabilities.description: /cost shows total cost ($), API duration, wall duration, and code changes (lines added/removed). /stats shows daily usage, session history, streaks, and model preferences. /usage shows subscription plan limits and rate limit status. /export saves conversation to file or clipboard with JSON and stream-JSON output formats for programmatic analysis.

sources.description: Claude Code CLI reference - /cost, /stats, /usage, /export commands

capabilities.name: Lifecycle Hooks
capabilities.description: Eight hook events (PreToolUse, PostToolUse, SessionStart, Stop, SubagentStart, SubagentStop, PreCompact, UserPromptSubmit) run shell commands at agent lifecycle points. PreToolUse supports allow/deny/modify with tool name matchers. Configured in .claude/settings.json or .claude/settings.local.json. Hooks receive JSON on stdin and return decisions on stdout.

sources.description: Claude Code Hooks documentation - lifecycle hook events and configuration

capabilities.name: Extension System
capabilities.description: Plugins bundle skills, agents, hooks, MCP servers, and LSP servers into distributable packages. Installed from marketplaces via /plugin install, from GitHub repos, or loaded locally with --plugin-dir. Skills are namespaced (e.g. /plugin-name:skill) to avoid conflicts. Plugin manifests (.claude-plugin/plugin.json) define metadata, version, and author. Marketplaces are Git repositories with an index.json catalog.

sources.description: Claude Code Plugins documentation - create and distribute plugins with skills, agents, hooks, and MCP servers
Claude Code Discover and install plugins - marketplace browsing and installation

capabilities.name: Model Selection
capabilities.description: Choose between multiple Claude models via --model flag or /model command. Available models: Claude Opus 4.6 (most intelligent, complex tasks), Claude Sonnet 4.6 (best speed/intelligence balance), Claude Haiku 4.5 (fastest). Model can be set per-session, per-project via CLAUDE.md, or via ANTHROPIC_MODEL environment variable.

sources.description: Claude Code overview - model selection and configuration options
sources.excerpt: Claude Code supports multiple models including Claude Opus 4.6, Sonnet 4.6, and Haiku 4.5, selectable via --model flag or /model command during sessions.

models.name: Claude Opus 4.6
models.note: Most intelligent, recommended for complex tasks
